item.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S6305; text as passed Senate: CR S6305; text of measure as introduced: CR S6297-6298)

Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S6305; text as passed Senate: CR S6305; text of measure as introduced: CR S6297-6298)

summary.text:
Recognizes the 60th anniversary of the Berlin Airlift as the largest and longest running humanitarian airlift operation in history.

Honors the service and sacrifice of the men and women who participated in and supported the Airlift.

Commends the close friendship forged between the American, British, and German people through the Airlift.

Applauds the men and women of the U.S. Air Force's Air Mobility Command who still work diligently to provide hope, save lives, and deliver freedom around the world in support of U.S. foreign policy objectives.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Recognizes the 60th anniversary of the Berlin Airlift as the largest and longest running humanitarian airlift operation in history.

Honors the service and sacrifice of the men and women who participated in and supported the Airlift.

Commends the close friendship forged between the American, British, and German people through the Airlift.

Applauds the men and women of the U.S. Air Force's Air Mobility Command who still work diligently to provide hope, save lives, and deliver freedom around the world in support of U.S. foreign policy objectives.

bill.title: A resolution commemorating the 60th anniversary of the Berlin Airlift and honoring the veterans of Operation Vittles.

item.title: A resolution commemorating the 60th anniversary of the Berlin Airlift and honoring the veterans of Operation Vittles.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
